suppress.notes: Suppress this CVE that is a wontfix from spring because it is about how spring provides a java deserialisation and invocation endpoint implementation that if you expose unauthenticated would be risky. They argue that's a you (app) problem.
false positive for commons_net file name: commons-text-*.jar
false positive as spring boot uses safe constructor in snakeyaml, see: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/33457 file name: snakeyaml-1.33.jar
6.5.0 version is only used by spotbugs who do not exercise vulnerability: https://github.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/discussions/2251 file name: bcel-6.5.0.jar
Suppress incorrect assignment of CVE-2020-5408 to more recent version, spring-security-crypto is @ v5.7.1 at time of suppression, latest know vulnerable version 5.3.x
